hey man...with this you show that you really care...nevertheless it is totally unnecessary to use this becasue of a simple reason... 
1. In Civ V menue you go to mods - downloads and now you can browse through all available mods and download and install them just by clicking.It works !
2. ANY PROBLEM people encounter with crashes and so on is for a hardware, system configuration or driver/update issues.
I have a brand new windows7 x86 system with clean registry and before installing anything else updated every piece of software to the latest + I really encourage everybody to search manually for update KB976264 for Win7 from Feb 2010 which increases compatibility with games (YOU WONT GET THIS BY AUT UPDATE!)...since July I installed some of the  pickiest cracked games out there like GTA IV,MassEffect2,Borderlands+all DLC,Anno1404,Dragon Age Origens/Awakening+all DLC,Fallout 3 GOTY (Unleashed release) and others and until today not encountered a real problem with none of them except for the ocasional crash all games have from time to time...regarding Civ V now
I play ArcticOne's release in Dx10 with SKIDROW crack for about 40 hours WITHOUT any issue...no freeze..no crash...loaded all sort of safes, autosaves and mods from inside the game or from menue...downloading mods from the net and installing....everything works perfect...certainly one of the most stable games from release since years and actually I play the true earth loc mod without issues since about 10h...everything works...no workarounds needed no restrictions found...saves...autosaves...all perfect
